programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: (2022) Gothic horror with Nathalie Emmanuel. A struggling New York artist discovers she has rich British relatives and accepts an invitation to a wedding in Whitby. Well, blood is blood.

programme.title: Beast
programme.desc: (2017) BAFTA-winning psychological thriller with Jessie Buckley and Johnny Flynn. A fragile young woman begins a potentially dangerous relationship with a mysterious outsider.

programme.title: Banel & Adama
programme.desc: (2023) Ramata-Toulaye Sy's drama with Khady Mane and Mamadou Diallo as a married couple with a complex backstory, whose happiness is about to be shaken by tribal expectation. In Pular/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street
programme.desc: (1956) Thriller starring Van Johnson as a blind playwright who overhears a kidnapping plot and, with his fiance (Vera Miles) and secretary (Cecil Parker), sets out to trap the villains.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: (1960) A western from Budd Boetticher. A hero and an outlaw must work together to save a kidnapped woman from a band of warring Comanche. Starring Randolph Scott and Nancy Gates.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir
programme.desc: (1947) Supernatural romance starring Rex Harrison as the spirit of a gruff sea captain who haunts widow Gene Tierney, only for her to fall in love with him. Directed by Joseph L Mankiewicz.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: (1984) Musical drama with Kevin Bacon. An unruly teen moves to a small town where dancing is banned. As more teens start misbehaving, can he change his elders' minds? Violence.

programme.title: Copshop
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller with Gerard Butler. A hitman gets himself arrested so that he can get to a bad guy who also got himself arrested to try and hide from the hitman.

programme.title: On the Road
programme.desc: (2012) Drama based on Jack Kerouac's novel with Sam Riley. A young American writer hits the road in 1947 in search of poetry, parties and sex. With Kristen Stewart and Elisabeth Moss.

programme.title: Race with the Devil
programme.desc: (1975) Horror thriller with Peter Fonda. Two holidaying couples disturb a ritual human sacrifice and must flee for their lives, pursued by the Satanists responsible.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: (1948) Adaptation of Graham Greene's story with Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey. A butler who is accused of murdering his wife, has only a schoolboy to fight his corner.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: (1966) Classic sci-fi adventure. Raquel Welch and Donald Pleasence are among the crew of a miniaturised submarine that's injected into an injured diplomat's body in a bid to save his life.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: (1992) Thriller with Harrison Ford and Sean Bean. An ex-CIA agent foils an IRA assassination plot. But a vengeful IRA man follows him back to America.

programme.title: Down Terrace
programme.desc: (2009) Comedy-drama. Father and son drug dealers (Robert and Robin Hill) think an informant threatens them, and are ready to kill to stop them.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: (1984) John Carpenter's sci-fi romance with Jeff Bridges and Karen Allen. An alien is stranded on Earth, where he assumes the form of a widow's dead husband - and finds the locals hostile.

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the...
programme.desc: ...Fallen: (2009) Raucous sci-fi action sequel with Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox. Can Sam and Mikaela prevent the scourge of the Decepticon robots from destroying the Earth?

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: (1994) Thriller with Harrison Ford. Can CIA agent Jack Ryan rescue US troops abandoned in Colombia, with only a renegade agent to help? Wouldn't bet against him. With Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: The Predator
programme.desc: (2018) Unrestrained reboot of the franchise defined by a ruthless extraterrestrial killer whose name says it all... and it's had a DNA upgrade. All the better to kill you with, my dear.

programme.title: Klokkenluider
programme.desc: (2022) Neil Maskell's comedy thriller with Tom Burke and Jenna Coleman. Two whistleblowers are stuck in a house with only their bickering security. And their story may not even have merit!

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: (2022) Gothic horror with Nathalie Emmanuel. A struggling New York artist discovers she has rich British relatives and accepts an invitation to a wedding in Whitby. Well, blood is blood.

programme.desc: (2017) BAFTA-winning psychological thriller with Jessie Buckley and Johnny Flynn. A fragile young woman begins a potentially dangerous relationship with a mysterious outsider.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir
programme.desc: (1947) Supernatural romance starring Rex Harrison as the spirit of a gruff sea captain who haunts widow Gene Tierney, only for her to fall in love with him. Directed by Joseph L Mankiewicz.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: (1984) Musical drama with Kevin Bacon. An unruly teen moves to a small town where dancing is banned. As more teens start misbehaving, can he change his elders' minds? Violence.

programme.title: Copshop
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller with Gerard Butler. A hitman gets himself arrested so that he can get to a bad guy who also got himself arrested to try and hide from the hitman.

programme.title: On the Road
programme.desc: (2012) Drama based on Jack Kerouac's novel with Sam Riley. A young American writer hits the road in 1947 in search of poetry, parties and sex. With Kristen Stewart and Elisabeth Moss.

programme.title: Race with the Devil
programme.desc: (1975) Horror thriller with Peter Fonda. Two holidaying couples disturb a ritual human sacrifice and must flee for their lives, pursued by the Satanists responsible.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: (1948) Adaptation of Graham Greene's story with Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey. A butler who is accused of murdering his wife, has only a schoolboy to fight his corner.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: (1966) Classic sci-fi adventure. Raquel Welch and Donald Pleasence are among the crew of a miniaturised submarine that's injected into an injured diplomat's body in a bid to save his life.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: (1992) Thriller with Harrison Ford and Sean Bean. An ex-CIA agent foils an IRA assassination plot. But a vengeful IRA man follows him back to America.

programme.title: Down Terrace
programme.desc: (2009) Comedy-drama. Father and son drug dealers (Robert and Robin Hill) think an informant threatens them, and are ready to kill to stop them.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: (1984) John Carpenter's sci-fi romance with Jeff Bridges and Karen Allen. An alien is stranded on Earth, where he assumes the form of a widow's dead husband - and finds the locals hostile.

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the...
programme.desc: ...Fallen: (2009) Raucous sci-fi action sequel with Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox. Can Sam and Mikaela prevent the scourge of the Decepticon robots from destroying the Earth?

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: (1994) Thriller with Harrison Ford. Can CIA agent Jack Ryan rescue US troops abandoned in Colombia, with only a renegade agent to help? Wouldn't bet against him. With Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: The Predator
programme.desc: (2018) Unrestrained reboot of the franchise defined by a ruthless extraterrestrial killer whose name says it all... and it's had a DNA upgrade. All the better to kill you with, my dear.

programme.desc: A look back at Sir David Attenborough's incredible life and career in broadcasting, including his youth as a fossil hunter and his pioneering use of technologies such as 3D and 4K.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: New & Exclusive. In the wide-open landscape of South Africa, wildebeest battle for herd hierarchy, fish fight it out on land and locusts give into a frenzy of cannibalism. (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: New & Exclusive. South of the Sahara, male giraffes swing their heads like wrecking balls, zebras boast the most powerful kick in the animal kingdom and chimpanzees wage war. (S1, ep 12)

programme.title: New: Gladiators
programme.desc: The Waterhole: As the dry season brings a band of gladiators to an African savannah watering hole, see a territory brawl and one honey badger's risky dance with a snake. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Impossible Animals
programme.desc: Coasts: Patrick Aryee examines the amazing animals that live on the coast. From crashing waves to extreme tides, surviving here takes ingenuity and incredible adaptations. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: New: Made For Murder
programme.desc: Denise Williams: She masterminded a deadly plot that claimed the life of her first husband Mike Williams. Was Denise Williams born with this murderous streak? (S2, ep 9)

programme.title: New: Made For Murder
programme.desc: Thomas Dunkley: The story of carer Thomas Dunkley, who was assigned to look after former boxer Shaun Cummins after he became paralysed and later killed him. (S2, ep 10)

programme.title: Sex And The City
programme.desc: No Ifs, Ands, Or Butts: Carrie goes on a date with furniture designer Aidan Shaw, but has to conceal her smoking habit. Samantha's new relationship is beset by racial politics. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Sex And The City
programme.desc: Are We *****?: Carrie is confused when Aidan seems reluctant to jump in the sack, Miranda learns she has chlamydia and Sam's sex life comes under the scrutiny of her neighbours. (S3, ep 6)

programme.title: Sex And The City
programme.desc: Drama Queens: Carrie panics when Aidan asks her to meet his family, Samantha starts taking Viagra recreationally and Charlotte steps up her hunt for a husband. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: Sex And The City
programme.desc: The Big Time: Carrie has an unexpected encounter with Big, Samantha worries that she's entering menopause and Charlotte decides that Trey is 'the one'. (S3, ep 8)

programme.title: Weight Loss Jab: Getting to the Right People? Tonight
programme.desc: Unless things change, more than half of the population will be classed as overweight or obese by 2050. With soaring demand for weight loss injections, Ranvir Singh investigates who is getting them and whether tighter restrictions regarding online prescribing will work

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: After years of partying in London, a newly sober Shiv Sheridan returns to Dublin for her grandmother's funeral, but trying to stay teetotal while being back with her family is not going to be easy. Comedy drama, starring Roisin Gallagher, with Ciarn Hinds

programme.desc: On couples night, Graham Norton hosts as Kerrick and Declan, Ricky and Sarah and Sadiq and Shabina compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, with Sally Dynevor, Barney Walsh and Zoe Williams saying what they see as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a 50,000 jackpot for their chosen charities

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz as new players Dan and Margaret hope they have what it takes to usurp the reigning champion and claim the title for themselves

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Patrick from Darwen, Nicky from Nottingham, Ella from Newport and Stewart from Stockport pit their wits against one of the Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Caleb and Ruby plan a day out as a family, Nicola starts to scheme, and Marlon betrays April's trust again

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: Football For All
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Brianna: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: The brutal murder of 16-year-old Brianna Ghey in a Warrington park shocked the nation. In this documentary, her mother Esther talks about her daughter, and how the tragedy has driven her fight for change. The film details the 28-hour search that led to the arrest of Brianna 15-year-old killers - Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe. Friends and family also talk about Brianna's trans journey, the struggles she faced, and the love she brought to those around her

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Battle of the Bins: End of Weekly Collections? Tonight
programme.desc: With stretched local authorities across the country proposing restrictions on weekly bin collections, Joe Crowley investigates fears that a reduction in collections and smaller household bins has already contributed to increasing problems with littering and fly-tipping

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Ryan's loyalty causes Sapphia to ask whether they should be together, and Viktor's commitment issues deepen when he demands a pre-nup.

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Nurses Charlie and Hazel battle to prevent a patient from falling into a diabetic coma while nurse practitioner Jack treats a man with an amputated thumb.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: There's more life-changing money on offer as Ant and Dec introduce NHS matrons Karis and Tim to the Limitless Ladder. They'd like to win a six-figure sum to buy a first home and help out their family and friends, but there's a huge surprise in store for them and a nerve-racking game to be played first. It's then husband and wife Arj and Charlotte's turn to climb the never-ending money ladder. Arj dreams of opening a restaurant one day, but can he make the dream a reality?

programme.title: The Mitchells vs the Machines

Katie Mitchell is ready to leave for college, but then her fretting father has the bright idea to drive her there himself, and packs the whole family into the car for a cross-country road trip. This enforced bonding experience is somewhat hampered by an robot uprising, as a scheming AI plots to launch every human being into space. Can the family - and the population of Earth - survive?

programme.desc: Fulham v Crystal Palace (Kick-off 12.15pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the quarter-final from Craven Cottage, as the Cottagers and Eagles meet in this competition for the first time since the 1906/07 season. programme.title: Brianna: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: The brutal murder of 16-year-old Brianna Ghey in a Warrington park shocked the nation. In this documentary, her mother Esther talks about her daughter, and how the tragedy has driven her fight for change. The film details the 28-hour search that led to the arrest of Brianna 15-year-old killers - Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe. Friends and family also talk about Brianna's trans journey, the struggles she faced, and the love she brought to those around her
